content: * *Hong Kah Constituency** ([Traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_character): 丰加單選區; [Simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_character): 丰加单选区) was a [single member constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) within [Jurong](/wiki/Jurong), Singapore. It was formed by carving out areas from [Boon Lay Constituency](/wiki/Boon_Lay_Constituency). It existed for a single electoral term from 1984 to 1988. [Yeo Cheow Tong](/wiki/Yeo_Cheow_Tong) was the only Member of Parliament for the SMC from 1984 to 1988. In 1988, it was absorbed into [Hong Kah Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Hong_Kah_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member of Parliament****Party****1984**[Yeo Cheow Tong](/wiki/Yeo_Cheow_Tong)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1980s [General Election 1984](/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election) PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****[Yeo Cheow Tong](/wiki/Yeo_Cheow_Tong)*****Unopposed***[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)22,062[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Hong Kah Constituency
